speaker: ALL
text_entry: SCENE II. A camp near Forres.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Alarum within. Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM, DONALBAIN, LENNOX, with Attendants, meeting a bleeding Sergeant

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: What bloody man is that? He can report,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: As seemeth by his plight, of the revolt

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: The newest state.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: This is the sergeant

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Who like a good and hardy soldier fought

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: 'Gainst my captivity. Hail, brave friend!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Say to the king the knowledge of the broil

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: As thou didst leave it.

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Doubtful it stood;

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: As two spent swimmers, that do cling together

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: And choke their art. The merciless Macdonwald--

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Worthy to be a rebel, for to that

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: The multiplying villanies of nature

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Do swarm upon him--from the western isles

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Of kerns and gallowglasses is supplied;

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: And fortune, on his damned quarrel smiling,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Show'd like a rebel's whore: but all's too weak:

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: For brave Macbeth--well he deserves that name--

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Disdaining fortune, with his brandish'd steel,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Which smoked with bloody execution,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Like valour's minion carved out his passage

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Till he faced the slave;

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Which ne'er shook hands, nor bade farewell to him,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Till he unseam'd him from the nave to the chaps,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: And fix'd his head upon our battlements.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: O valiant cousin! worthy gentleman!

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: As whence the sun 'gins his reflection

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Shipwrecking storms and direful thunders break,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: So from that spring whence comfort seem'd to come

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Discomfort swells. Mark, king of Scotland, mark:

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: No sooner justice had with valour arm'd

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Compell'd these skipping kerns to trust their heels,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: But the Norweyan lord surveying vantage,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: With furbish'd arms and new supplies of men

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Began a fresh assault.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Dismay'd not this

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Our captains, Macbeth and Banquo?

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Yes;

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: As sparrows eagles, or the hare the lion.

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: If I say sooth, I must report they were

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: As cannons overcharged with double cracks, so they

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Doubly redoubled strokes upon the foe:

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Except they meant to bathe in reeking wounds,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: Or memorise another Golgotha,

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: I cannot tell.

speaker: Sergeant
text_entry: But I am faint, my gashes cry for help.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: So well thy words become thee as thy wounds;

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: They smack of honour both. Go get him surgeons.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Exit Sergeant, attended

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Who comes here?

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Enter ROSS

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: The worthy thane of Ross.

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: What a haste looks through his eyes! So should he look

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: That seems to speak things strange.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: God save the king!

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Whence camest thou, worthy thane?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: From Fife, great king;

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Where the Norweyan banners flout the sky

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: And fan our people cold. Norway himself,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: With terrible numbers,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Assisted by that most disloyal traitor

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: The thane of Cawdor, began a dismal conflict;

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Till that Bellona's bridegroom, lapp'd in proof,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Confronted him with self-comparisons,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Point against point rebellious, arm 'gainst arm.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Curbing his lavish spirit: and, to conclude,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: The victory fell on us.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Great happiness!

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That now

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Sweno, the Norways' king, craves composition:

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Nor would we deign him burial of his men

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Till he disbursed at Saint Colme's inch

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Ten thousand dollars to our general use.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: No more that thane of Cawdor shall deceive

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Our bosom interest: go pronounce his present death,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: And with his former title greet Macbeth.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: I'll see it done.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: What he hath lost noble Macbeth hath won.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Exeunt
